ygData.subject: Re: INT vs memorizable spells
ygData.msgSnippet: rangers are a mix of warrior and druid and since druids are closer to clerics then any other magical class.. I think rangers would just depend on wisdom for
ygData.messageBody:
rangers are a mix of warrior and druid and since druids are closer to
clerics then any other magical class.. I think rangers would just depend on
wisdom for spells like they ALREADY do.. hehe
Wis should determine for cleric/druid/ranger/<necro>
Int for wiz/mag/enchant...

-----Original Message-----
From: Avron Vallengard <avron@...>
To: EverQuest <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, April 06, 1999 11:46 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] INT vs memorizable spells


>From: Avron Vallengard <avron@...>
>
>
>About that ancient discussion with someone suggesting that INT should
>determine how many spells you could memorize.. (Sorry haven't read my
>email in a while hehe;)
>Anyways, I think it would be fair, almost, only for wizard classes and not
>for the clerical classes which rely on WIS for mana and thus will spend
>most of their bonus points on wisdom instead of INT.. Then again you could
>have it being based on INT for wizard types and WIS for cleric types..
>Only.. Poor damn rangers that are a mix of both.. hehe
>
>- Avron Vallengard -
>
>
